pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [ ] depends on: #20425 
- [x] depends on: #20426

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [26ae4c662b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20424/commits/26ae4c662bbbbb2b7f6cb142ca2460bf8edb08c8)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.AdicCompletion.Noetherian` (new file)|1221|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.Eval` (new file)|1278|

</details>

---

`+ Ideal.iInf_pow_smul_eq_bot_of_le_jacobson`
`+ Ideal.iInf_pow_smul_eq_bot_of_noZeroSMulDivisors`
`+ IsHausdorff.of_isDomain`
`+ IsHausdorff.of_isLocalRing`
`+ IsHausdorff.of_le_jacobson`
`+ IsHausdorff.of_noZeroSMulDivisors`
`+ _root_.IsAdicCompleteAt`
`+ _root_.IsHausdorffAt`
`+ _root_.IsPrecompleteAt`
`+ _root_.isHausdorffAt_iff`
`+ algHomEquiv`
`+ algHom_ext`
`+ algebraMap_eq`
`+ convergesAt`
`+ convergesAtEval`
`+ convergesAtEval_algebraMap`
`+ convergesAt_eq_top`
`+ convergesAt_eq_top_iff`
`+ eval`
`+ evalAlgHom`
`+ evalEq_coe`
`+ evalEq_eval`
`+ evalEq_eval_of_mem`
`+ evalEq_map_C_X`
`+ evalEq_map_algebraMap`
`+ evalEq_map_comp_C`
`+ eval_C`
`+ eval_X`
`+ eval_X_pow`
`+ eval_coe`
`+ eval_eq_eval_trunc`
`+ eval_one`
`+ eval_zero`
`+ instance [IsLocalRing R] : IsHausdorff (maximalIdeal R) M`
`+ instance _root_.IsAdicCompleteAt.of_algHom [IsNoetherianRing R]`
`+ map_X_mem_jacobson`
`+ ringHom_ext`
`+ smul_def`
`+ trunc_C_mul`
`+ trunc_map`
`+ trunc_mul_C`
`+ trunc_one_X`
`+ trunc_one_left`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20425~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20426~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Does `EvalEq p` necessarily uniquely identify `a`? If not, then perhaps this should be called `HasEval p` instead, to match `HasSum`, `HasDerivAt` etc.
Only under some separability conditions. I'll change the name.

This is ~~probably the only place~~ one place where this PR is more general than #15019; that PR uses a [T2Space assumption](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15019/files#diff-b53af0fbdc571aa34f4b4305e167fd8ee826328acc17b1c26a80ec9fff585fb4R260-R272). (In `evalâ‚‚` where T2Space is not assumed, it makes an arbitrary choice.)

Oh I'm not aware of that PR. Their results are definitely more general. We probably don't care about evaluation at non-hausdorff rings anyway as the value is not unique.

A slight drawback is that they require a topology on `R` but in some cases we might not want to choose a topology (e.g. on $$\mathbb{Z}_p[[X]]$$ there's a $$p$$-adic one and a $$X$$-adic one). Maybe we should keep both?

```suggestion
    (f.comp_algebraMap.trans g.comp_algebraMap.symm) hX hX') :)
```
means the same thing
Under what circumstances does this coincide with the appropriate topological sum `tsum`?
They should be the same when `R` and has the `I`-adic topology for some `I` containing `x` and is Hausdorff.

Why not
```suggestion
  mul_mem' {p q} := by
    rintro âŸ¨a, haâŸ©, âŸ¨b, hbâŸ©
    exact âŸ¨a * b, ha.mul hbâŸ©
```
or maybe
```suggestion
  mul_mem' {p q} hp hq := âŸ¨_, ha.choose_spec.mul hb.choose_specâŸ©
```

pullRequest.title: feat(RingTheory): evaluation of power series
